Dear Mr. Genwright:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 Be signed and dated.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact, Claudia Triestram, area manager, at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
On 12/11/20, a youth asked staff member for an envelope multiple times and was
told no. Youth hit staff member. Three staff members took youth down and placed
youth in isolation. Youth has marks and bruises from incident. Youth was released
from isolation 12/16/20 and allowed to make a 5 minute call. Youth has multiple
mental health issues and has been given medication, but no counseling. Youth was
also given unknown injection upon arrival.
INVESTIGATION:
On December 17, 2020 DCWL reviewed the complaint as outlined above. I initiated
a special investigation the same day by interviewing Youth A with another DHHS
Worker by FaceTime. Agency staff and youth were interviewed at the facility.
Documents and video of the event were received and reviewed in this investigation.
What follows is information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
On December 17, 2020 I interviewed Youth A along with DHHS Worker by
FaceTime while Youth A was at the facility. Youth A was being released from the
facility later in the day. Youth A is a 13-year-old female who has been at Saginaw
County Detention Home since September 2020. Youth A indicated she was aware
why she was being interviewed. Youth A stated it all started by her asking for an
envelope. She reported that she asked Staff 1 for an envelope and Staff 1 told her
to “wait a minute.” Youth A reported she waited ten minutes and asked again. The
unit was out of envelopes and another staff needed to come back to the unit so Staff
1 could go get more envelopes. Youth A stated Staff 2 entered the unit and she
asked him for an envelope and Staff 1 told her she was manipulating. Youth A
reported that Staff 2 told her to go to her room and Staff 1 said no I am going to put
her in her room. Youth A stated that is when Staff 2 said she was sizing up Staff 1
and pushed her into her room. Youth A reported she could not remember where
Staff 2 placed his hands when he pushed her into her room. Youth A stated she
reached around Staff 2 and hit Staff 1.
Youth A reported a behavior management timeout, BMT, refusal was called over the
radio prior to her being shoved into her room. Youth A stated if a BMT refusal is
called then you have to give up your shoes, bedding and the door is closed and
locked. Youth A reported she still had her shoes, and she hid behind the toilet in her
room. Youth A reported that staff cannot see you from the window in the door if you
hide behind the toilet. Youth A stated Staff 3 entered her room and took her bedding
and one shoe. She stated she still had one shoe, that she kept it to feel like she still
had control. Youth A reported that Staff 3 got mad and another staff entered her
3

room and grabbed her from behind the toilet. Youth A stated she grabbed Staff 3’s
face mask, he “stomped” on her, but she thought it was an accident.
Youth A reported that she was standing by the toilet and staff grabbed her hands
first, that she fell to the floor, then staff grabbed her feet. Youth A reported that Staff
3 was by her head on her left side of her body, Staff 2 had her left foot and Staff 5
had her right foot. Youth A stated that Staff 1 was not there. Youth A stated she
was hitting staff, rolling around and trying to get away from staff. Youth A said this is
when Staff 3 “stomped” on her while she was laying on her stomach on the floor.
She stated she felt her rib crack, that she could not breath and that she was
screaming at staff, “my rib, my rib.” Youth A reported Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 5 then
left her room and she stayed on the floor crying. Youth A stated she still had Staff
3’s face mask. She stated she was able to get the small piece of metal out of the
mask and kept it in her hand.
Youth A reported she refused her meds that day and refused to eat lunch. She
stated she cut her left wrist and smeared blood on her leg. Youth A reported that
there was blood everywhere. Youth A stated that Staff 6 came into her room to talk
with her and Staff 3 joined him. She stated staff cleaned her wound and talked with
her about the incident. Youth A stated she did not see the nurse that day but did the
next morning.
It should be noted that Youth A described Staff 5 being in the room getting her shoe
with Staff 2 and Staff 3. Staff 5 was not in the unit that day or seen on camera
footage entering her room. Staff 4 was the staff member assisting Staff 2 and Staff
3 in Youth A’s room getting her shoe.
Youth A stated she saw the nurse the next day. Youth A reported that she had a
bruise on her arm and her ribs were still hurting but she did not tell the nurse about
either injury. Youth A reported that the nurse looked at her cut and put some cream
on it. Youth A reported she was in her room for four days and only left to shower.
Youth A said that one day staff forgot she was in her room and did not check on her
for 45 minutes. Youth A reported having a good relationship with staff.
On December 18, 2020 I interviewed Staff 1 in person at the facility along with
DHHS Worker and Officer 1. Staff 1 reported that she was with the youth during
their free time when Youth A asked for an envelope. Staff 1 reported she was the
only one on the unit and could not leave to get an envelope at that time, which she
explained to Youth A. Staff 1 reported that Youth A complained a bit and that is
when Staff 2 entered the unit. Staff 1 stated that right away Youth A asked Staff 2
for an envelope. Staff 1 stated she told Youth A she was being disrespectful and
asked her to go to her room. She said Youth A refused, stood up from the table and
walked toward her. Staff 1 stated that is when Staff 2 stepped in-between and Youth
A reached around Staff 2 and hit the right side of her face. Staff 1 stated the hit
knocked her face mask off. Staff 1 reported that Staff 2 put Youth A in her room and
4

a supervisor was called into the unit. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 asked her to step off
the unit and she has not worked with Youth A since the incident.
Staff 1 reported that this was the first time she ever had a physical incident with
Youth A. She described Youth A as manipulative. Staff 1 reported that when Youth
A refused to go to her room that Staff 2 called a BMT over the radio. Staff 1 stated
she felt threatened when Youth A walked up to her.
On December 18, 2020 I interviewed Staff 2 in person at the facility along with
DHHS Worker and Officer 1. Staff 2 reported that he came into the unit after break
and was immediately asked by Youth A for an envelope. He stated that Staff 1
redirected Youth A and told her that she was manipulating. Staff 2 reported that
Youth A then “started arguing, not listening and was full out disrespecting staff.” He
stated he directed Youth A to go to her door and she acted like she could not hear
him. Staff 2 reported he then called a BMT over the radio. Staff 2 reported Youth A
got up and started going toward Staff 1. Staff 2 reported he stepped in-between and
that is when Youth A reached around him and hit Staff 1. Staff 2 stated he “shoved”
Youth A into her room. Staff 1 said that Youth A does not think before she acts, and
one never knows what she is going to do. Staff 2 reported that Youth A got up fast
from her chair and headed toward Staff 1. Staff 2 described grabbing Youth A’s shirt
in her shoulder area and “pushed” her into her room. He stated Youth A did not fall,
she continued to yell at staff and was still escalated.
Staff 2 reported Staff 3 entered the unit to talk with Youth A. Staff 2 reported that he
heard commotion and went in and Youth A was trying to grab Staff 3’s jacket. Staff
2 reported he grabbed Youth A’s left arm and Staff 4 grabbed Youth A’s right arm.
Staff 2 reported that Youth A was standing up the entire time and never was on the
floor.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was taking her fingernails and scratching herself. He stated
she dug herself and she was bleeding. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 cleaned the
scratches, made a referral to CMH and Youth A was placed on the nurse’s list to be
examined. Staff 2 reported he talked with Youth A about her behavior and tried to
help her understand why she received a BMT. Staff 2 reported he did not see any
marks or bruises on Youth A and has not seen her since the incident.
On December 18, 2020 I interviewed Staff 3 in person at the facility along with
DHHS Worker and Officer 1. Staff 3 reported that he heard the call for a BMT and
went to view the incident on camera. He stated he walked to the unit and entered
Youth A’s room to talk with her and see how she was doing. Staff 3 reported from
the video he could see that Youth A still had her shoes. Staff 3 reported he entered
Youth A’s room and got her bedding and one flip flop. Staff 3 reported that Youth A
was angry and tried grabbing his jacket. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 got Youth A’s left
arm and Staff 4 got her right arm. Staff 3 stated he was able to “snap back my coat.”
Staff 3 stated Youth A was standing the entire time and was never on the floor. Staff
3 denied stepping on Youth A and stated it would have been impossible for him as
5

she was standing the entire time. Staff 3 reported Youth A sat on the bed once she
was no longer had ahold of his coat.
Staff 3 described Youth A’s behavior as challenging but never physical. He stated
she has had multiple BMT’s but that normally her nature is not violent. Staff 3
reported Youth A as having self-harming behavior where she will pick at old scabs
until she bleeds. Staff 3 reported Youth A was picking at scrabs and was bleeding.
He stated he cleaned her up, put her name on the nurse’s list and put her on the
CMH list. He denied seeing any bruises on Youth A and that she did not report any
injuries.
On December 18, 2020 I interviewed Nurse in person at the facility along with DHHS
Worker and Officer 1. Nurse reported that Youth A has severe acne on her arms
and often she will pick the pimples causing them to bleed. Nurse reported that
Youth A has never cut herself, that her self-harm is rubbing or picking the acne until
it bleeds. Nurse reported that Youth A’s mother signs off on every medication that
Youth A receives. Nurse denied that Youth A ever received an injection at any time
while at the facility.
Nurse reported that she saw Youth A on December 14, 2020 because she was on
the nurse’s list for a mark on her wrist. Nurse reported that Youth A had scratches
on her abdomen. She stated the scratches hardly broke the skin. Nurse reported
that she examined Youth A’s wrists; there were no marks on Youth A’s right wrist
and the left wrist had a pimple on it that had been picked. Nurse stated to Youth A,
“that’s not new, that was there on Friday.” Nurse reported later in the day that Youth
A asked her to look at her cheek area because it hurt. Nurse stated she did not see
any marks and when she touched the area Youth A did not indicate that it hurt.
Nurse stated she completed an incident report documenting this information.
Nurse reported that she examined Youth A on December 17, 2020 and this time
there was a bruise on her cheek, scratches on her abdomen and left hip. Nurse
stated she took pictures. Nurse reported that Youth A told her that she did not know
how the bruise got there. Nurse stated the Youth A never said that her ribs hurt or
anything on her body hurt and did not mention the events from the previous day.
Nurse stated she only knew about it because of the report from staff.
On December 18, 2020 I interviewed Staff 4 over the phone along with DHHS
Worker and Officer 1. Staff 4 reported he entered Youth A’s room because Youth A
was yelling at Staff 3 and had grabbed his jacket. Staff 4 reported he held Youth A’s
right arm and Staff 2 got Youth A’s left arm. He stated Youth A let go of Staff 3’s
coat and they let go of her arms. Staff 4 reported that Youth A sat on her bed and
he walked out of her room. Staff 4 stated that Youth A was standing when he
entered the room and was never on the floor. He stated Youth A never touched
Staff 3 only grabbed his coat. Staff 4 stated he and Staff 2 grabbed her arms to
remove them from Staff 3’s coat and that was the end of it.
6

On December 18, 2020 I interviewed Director in person at the facility. Director
reported that when a youth assaults a staff or peer, confinement in their room can be
up to 72 hours. Director stated the behavior is reviewed, discussed and approvals
have to be given for room confinement. Youth A received a 72-hour room
confinement, and 15-minute room checks were completed. Youth A was able to
leave her room for a shower. Medication and meals were brought to Youth A’s
room. Documentation of the facility’s policy and room checks were reviewed and
discussed.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
I reviewed four Incident Reports dated on 12/13/2020 regarding the events that led
to Youth A being placed in her bedroom and the events that occurred while she was
in her bedroom. The Incident Reports were completed by the staff that were
involved in the BMT, with Youth A. One incident report indicates that Staff 2 placed
Youth A into her room. Another incident report indicates that due to Youth A hitting
Staff 1, Staff 2 “made sure Youth A was placed into her room.” A third incident
report indicates, Staff 2 stepped in front of Youth A to prevent her from going after
Staff 1 and assisted Youth A into her room.
I reviewed a video of the altercation between Youth A and Staff 1 and Staff 2. The
video shows Staff 2 enter the unit while Youth A and Staff 1 are sitting at different
tables. Staff 1 is seen walking towards Youth A, it appears she is talking to her, then
is seen getting keys out as she is walking toward Youth A’s bedroom door. Staff 1
opens Youth A’s door, Youth A is still sitting at the table and Staff 2 is standing in the
middle of the unit. Staff 2 is seen raising his walkie talkie to his mouth (a BMT is
being called in). Youth A gets up from the table and walks toward Staff 1, Staff 2
walks toward Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth A is standing in front of Staff 1 and it
appears they are talking back and forth. Staff 2 intervenes between Youth A and
Staff 1. Staff 2 puts his right hand on Youth A’s left side and pushes her toward her
room. His right hand is on Youth A’s shoulder area. Youth A is out of camera view
as is Staff 2. Staff 1 can be seen standing next to the open door. Staff 2 then
comes into camera view and is closing the door to Youth A’s room. The door
appears to be pushed back by Youth A and Youth A’s hand/arm can be seen hitting
Staff 1. Staff 2 is seen closing Youth A’s door while Staff 1 is behind him. This
interaction starts at 10:47:54 and ends at 10:49:11.
There is further video that shows Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 enter Youth A’s
bedroom. It was reported by Director that Youth A’s belongings needed to be
removed from her room per policy, so she is not able to harm herself while in a BMT.
Video shows Staff 2 and Staff 3 in Youth A’s bedroom for 8 seconds before Staff 4
enters. All three staff exit Youth A’s room 7 seconds later. It appears that Staff 3 no
longer has a face mask on when he exits Youth A’s room. He was wearing a face
mask when he went into the room.
7

I reviewed the facility’s Security Management Section 400 Policy 4.22. Physical
Force. Youth A’s verbal statements toward Staff 1 did not warrant Staff 2 pushing
Youth A into her room. This is not a behavior management technique that is taught
or approved.
I reviewed the facility’s Room Confinement Monitoring Record for the time period
that Youth A was confided to her room. Room checks were completed every 15
minutes.
I reviewed the facility’s Discipline and Group Management Section 300 Policy 3.12
Group Intervention Program. The policy outlines time limits, authorization and report
requirements for discipline and group management. The time limit for Youth A’s
room confinement fell within the policy for assaulting staff.
An Incident Report dated 12/13/2020 indicated a referral to CMH and the nurse had
been made due to Youth A’s self-harming behavior. Youth A was picking scabs and
bumps on her wrist making them bleed. The incident report indicates that Youth A’s
cut was washed, and antibiotic cream was applied to the area.
I reviewed an incident report dated 12/14/2020 completed by Nurse. The report
indicated that Youth A was on the nurses list for a cut on her wrist. Both wrists were
examined by the nurse. The incident report indicated that nothing was on Youth A’s
right wrist but her left wrist had a pimple on it that she had been picking. The
marking was not new and had been previously treated by the nurse. The incident
report indicates, the mark was present before Youth A’s altercation with staff over
the weekend.
An incident report dated 12/14/2020 completed by Nurse reported that while passing
noon meds, Youth A asked her if she could see any bruising on her right cheek.
Nurse reported that she inspected the area and did not see any bruising or
discoloration. Nurse touched Youth A’s face and Youth A reported to her that it did
not hurt in that area.
An Incident Report dated 12/17/2020 completed by the Nurse indicated that Youth A
had a bruise on her right cheek and right forearm, eczema on bilateral creases of
her arms, scratches on her abdomen on her left hip that Youth A indicated were self-
inflicted. The report indicated when Youth A was asked about the bruising and she
stated she “doesn’t know.” Pictures were taken and the report indicated that there
were no other bruising or markings on Youth A’s back, front chest or torso. Legs
and arms have acne which is being treated.
Youth A’s medication log summary and medication administration records were
reviewed. There were no entries of Youth A ever receiving an injection while at the
facility.
8

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.10157 Health services; policies and procedures.
(1) A facility shall establish and follow written health
service policies and procedures that address all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical and dental care.
(b) Health screening procedures.
(c) Maintenance of health records.
(d) Storage of medications.
(e) Dispensing medication.
(f) Personnel authorized to dispense medications.
ANALYSIS: The facility made the referral to CMH for Youth A to receive
mental health treatment. Youth A never received an injection
while at the facility. There is no documentation of any injection
ever given to Youth A while at the facility. Nurse A reported a
youth would only receive an injection if they had gonorrhea and
it would be documented in the youth’s medical chart.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.10103 Program statement.
Written policies and procedures pertaining to the
admission, care, and release of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 2 stated he pushed Youth A into her room and is seen in
video footage pushing Youth A into her bedroom. This is a
violation of the facility’s CPI methods and their Security
Management Policy.
TEHCNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical Assistance was provided regarding how staff in this
situation may have been the cause of escalating Youth A’s
behavior. Staff need to better understand how their response to
a youth’s actions can led to escalating a situation. Youth A
struck Staff 1 after being pushed into her room by Staff 2.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
9

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.10176 Resident confinement room.
Confinement to a resident confinement room for up to 72
hours may be used when a resident has been charged with
a major rule violation that endangers the safety of residents
or others or endangers the security of the facility.
ANALYSIS: Youth A was placed in seclusion for assaulting a staff member,
which is considered a major violation at the facility. The time in
seclusion followed the facility’s time limits, authorization and
reporting requirements.
TEHCNICAL ASSITANCE
Technical Assistance was provided regarding Youth A being in
confinement for 72 hours when she did not have a history of
aggressive behavior, her behaviors were escalated after being
pushed by staff, and her behaviors had calmed down soon after
she was placed in confinement. Youth A was able to debrief
with Staff 3 about the situation and change her behavior. Youth
A demonstrated in less than 72 hours that her behavior
changed. It is recommended that each situation be assessed
individually as appropriate for the length of time in confinement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, the recommendation is to
continue the current licensing status.
